bioghist.p: Anthony S. Travis is an historian of science and technology at the Sidney M. Edelstein Center, Hebrew University of Jerusalem. In 1993 he and Theodor Benfey of the Chemical Heritage Foundation began the development of a 12-panel traveling exhibit on dyes and pigments, entitled "Colors, Culture, and the Chemical Sciences."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials relating to the "Colors, Culture, and the Chemical Sciences" exhibit. It includes correspondence, drafts of topics for the exhibit, meeting schedules and agendas, articles on dye chemistry, slides of chemical formulas and dye production apparatus, a list of the slides, copies of the Edelstein Center newsletter, and miscellaneous letters and papers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
